com.pump.plaf

Class DecoratedPanelUI.Border

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.pump.plaf.DecoratedPanelUI.Border
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    javax.swing.border.Border
    Enclosing class:
    DecoratedPanelUI

    public static class DecoratedPanelUI.Border
extends java.lang.Object
implements javax.swing.border.Border
    The Border installed by a DecoratedPanelUI.

    This border was originally designed to be used in combination with the DecorationPanelUI, but it can also be used independently as needed.

        public static final ObservableProperties.Key<java.awt.Paint> BORDER_PAINT

      • BEVEL_SHADOW_THETA

        public static final ObservableProperties.Key<java.lang.Float> BEVEL_SHADOW_THETA
        The attribute defining the angle the bevel shadows and highlights are oriented, ranging from 0 to 2*pi. A value of zero positions the shadow on the left side, and it rotates clockwise from there: so a value of pi/2 puts the shadow on the top and a value of pi puts the shadow on the right. The highlight is always opposite the shadow.

      • BEVEL_SHADOW_LAYER_COUNT

        public static final ObservableProperties.Key<java.lang.Integer> BEVEL_SHADOW_LAYER_COUNT
        The attribute defining the number of paint operations used to layer the bevel shadow, ranging from 0 to 20.

      • BEVEL_HIGHLIGHT_LAYER_COUNT

        public static final ObservableProperties.Key<java.lang.Integer> BEVEL_HIGHLIGHT_LAYER_COUNT
        The attribute defining the number of paint operations used to layer the bevel highlight, ranging from 0 to 20.

      • BEVEL_SHADOW_MAX_BLEND

        public static final ObservableProperties.Key<java.lang.Float> BEVEL_SHADOW_MAX_BLEND
        The attribute defining how dark to make the shadow bevel, ranging from 0 to 1.

      • BEVEL_HIGHLIGHT_MAX_BLEND

      • paintBorder

        public void paintBorder(java.awt.Component c,
                        java.awt.Graphics g,
                        int x,
                        int y,
                        int width,
                        int height)
        Paint this border.

        This asks a DecoratedPanelUI.Renderer to paint everything, but first uses a clipping to punch a whole in the middle of the Graphics2D. (So only the border will show.)

        If the component has applied a DecoratedPanelUI: then attributes from that panel are also retrieved so the gradient/glaze/etc appear correct in the the border.

        Specified by:
        paintBorder in interface javax.swing.border.Border

        Specified by:
